datasetPresenter.name: gassBGS_massSpec_Secretome_IEC_infection_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Secretome of Giardia intestinalis isolates WB clone C6 (ATCC30957; assemblage A) and GS, clone H7 (ATCC50581; assemblage B) during interaction with intestinal epithelial cells (IECs)
datasetPresenter.description: Secretome of Giardia intestinalis isolates WB clone C6 (ATCC30957; assemblage A) and GS, clone H7 (ATCC50581; assemblage B) during interaction with intestinal epithelial cells (IECs). To identify putative virulence factors and elucidate mechanistic pathways leading to disease, proteomics was used to identify the major excretory-secretory products (ESPs) when Giardia trophozoites of WB and GS isolates (assemblages A and B, respectively) interact with intestinal epithelial cells (IECs) in vitro at two time points (2hr and 6hr).

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_massSpec_Secretome_IEC_infection_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Secretome of Giardia intestinalis isolates WB clone C6 (ATCC30957; assemblage A) and GS, clone H7 (ATCC50581; assemblage B) during interaction with intestinal epithelial cells (IECs)
datasetPresenter.description: Secretome of Giardia intestinalis isolates WB clone C6 (ATCC30957; assemblage A) and GS, clone H7 (ATCC50581; assemblage B) during interaction with intestinal epithelial cells (IECs). To identify putative virulence factors and elucidate mechanistic pathways leading to disease, proteomics was used to identify the major excretory-secretory products (ESPs) when Giardia trophozoites of WB and GS isolates (assemblages A and B, respectively) interact with intestinal epithelial cells (IECs) in vitro at two time points (2hr and 6hr).

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_massSpec_Trophozoite_Secretome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteomic analysis of pellet and media (secreted) protein fractions from mid-log phase cultures of Giardia Assemblage A isolate WB.
datasetPresenter.description:
Giardia trophozoites from the genome reference strain WB (assemblage A) were cultured in TYI-S-33 under standard conditions (Keister DB., 1983) and harvested during the midlog phase of their growth curves. Protein preparations from Giardia cells and culture supernatants were trypsin digested, mixed with peptide internal standards and analysed by LC-MS/MS. In the project, we’ve also used two mass spec instruments to analyse these samples namely Velos (Orbitrap Velos) and QEx (Q Exactive). Resulting spectra were searched (PEAKS Studio 7.0) against a combination of GiardiaDB protein sequence databases and common contamination and internal standards.

Samples:
WBP Qex = pellet from isolate WB analyzed by Q Exactive
WBP Velos = pellet from isolate WB analyzed by Orbitrap Velos
WBS Qex = supernatant from isolate WB analyzed by Q Exactive
WBS Velos = supernatant from isolate WB analyzed by Orbitrap Velos

datasetPresenter.name: gassBGS_massSpec_Trophozoite_Secretome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteomic analysis of pellet and media (secreted) protein fractions from mid-log phase cultures of Giardia Assemblage B isolate GS.
datasetPresenter.description:
Giardia trophozoites from the genome reference strain GS (assemblage B), were cultured in TYI-S-33 under standard conditions (Keister DB., 1983) and harvested during the midlog phase of their growth curves. Protein preparations from Giardia cells and culture supernatants were trypsin digested, mixed with peptide internal standards and analysed by LC-MS/MS. In the project, we’ve also used two mass spec instruments to analyse these samples namely Velos (Orbitrap Velos) and QEx (Q Exactive). Resulting spectra were searched (PEAKS Studio 7.0) against a combination of GiardiaDB protein sequence databases and common contamination and internal standards.

Samples:
GSP Qex = pellet from isolate WB analyzed by Q Exactive
GSP Velos = pellet from isolate WB analyzed by Orbitrap Velos
GSS Qex = supernatant from isolate WB analyzed by Q Exactive
GSS Velos = supernatant from isolate WB analyzed by Orbitrap Velos

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_Ansell_AxenicTrophozoites_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Time-dependent transcriptional changes in axenic trophozoites
datasetPresenter.summary: Time-Dependent Transcriptional Changes in Axenic Giardia duodenalis Trophozoites
datasetPresenter.description: RNA sequencing was used to characterize the mRNA transcriptome of Giardia duodenalis trophozoites in axenic culture, at log (48 h of growth), stationary (60 h), and declining (96 h) growth phases.

datasetPresenter.name: ssalATCC50377_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and Annotation for Spironucleus salmonicida ATCC50377
datasetPresenter.description:
The genome sequence and annotation for the Atlantic salmon pathogen Spironucleus salmonicida ATCC50377 reveals a genome size of 12.6 Mbp distributed in nine chromosomes.

S. salmonicida ATCC 50377, previously known as S. barkhanus, was isolated from a muscle abscess in Atlantic salmon grown in Vesteralen Sea in northern Norway. Cells were obtained from American Type Culture Collection (ATCC) and grown in axenic culture following the ATCC protocol.

Sequencing:
Total genomic DNA was isolated from Spironucleus salmonicida ATCC50377 trophozoites and sequenced using two methods:
1. Genome Sequencer FLX with GS FLX Titanium series reagents, one run with single shotgun reads and one run from a sequencing library with 3 kbp inserts, yielded 454 reads of 55× genome coverage.
2. Illumina Genome Analyzer IIx instrument, one run with paired-end reads with 100 bp in read length and pairs are 350 bp apart, which yielded Illumina reads of over 200× coverage.

The genome was assembled using Celera Assembler v. 6.0, characterized by optical mapping, and annotated using an in-house annotation pipeline.

datasetPresenter.name: gassA2DH_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and Annotation for Giardia Assemblage A2 isolate DH
datasetPresenter.description: Genomic DNA was isolated from Giardia Assemblage A2 isolate DH trophozoites grown in TYI-s33 medium and harvested in late log or early stationary phase. Rapid fragment, 3 kb, 6 kb, and 8 kb paired-end libraries were constructed and sequenced using 454 DNA FLX methods. De novo genome assembly was performed using MIRA v3.0 and NEWBLER v2.5. The genome was assembled using MIRA v. 3.0, NEWBLER v. 2.5 and Sequencher v.4.9 resulting in 124X coverage of the genome.

datasetPresenter.name: gassBGS_B_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and Annotation for Giardia Assemblage B isolate GS_B
datasetPresenter.description: Giardia Assemblage B isolate GS_B was originally obtained from a symptomatic human. For the purposes of this genome sequencing project, genomic DNA was isolated from trophozoites grown in TYI-s33 medium and harvested in late log or early stationary phase. Rapid Fragment, 3 kb and 8 kb paired-end libraries were constructed and sequenced using 454 DNA FLX methods. The genome was assembled using Phred/Phrap/consed; Arachne v.2 resulting in 53X coverage of the genome.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and Annotation for Giardia Assemblage A isolate WB
datasetPresenter.description:
G. lamblia Assemblage A isolate WB sequence, assembly and annotation

DNA was extracted from trophozoites and purified. Sequencing was initially done using LI-COR automated sequencers and completed by capillary sequencing (BigDye terminator chemistry) on an Applied Biosystems 3700. Reads were assembled using the ARACHNE 2.0 genome assembly software with basecalling by either LI-COR software (for LI-COR generated reads) or PHRED.

datasetPresenter.name: gassBGS_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Draft Genome Sequence of Giardia intestinalis Assemblage B Isolate GS

Three rounds of sequencing of the GS genome using the 454 FLX sequencer generated 808,181 high-quality reads with an average length of 227 bp (182 Mbp; 16× coverage). The final assembled sequence was distributed in 2,931 contigs with an average length of 3,753 bp (Table S1). Automated ORF prediction identified 6,768 ORFs and manual curation of the data resulted in a final set of 4,470 intact (mean length 1,836 bp) and 221 interrupted protein coding genes.

datasetPresenter.name: gassEP15_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Sequence and annotation of Giardia Assemblage E isolate P15

Genomic DNA was sequenced using a Genome Sequencer FLX/Titanium instrument. Three runs with the Genome Sequencer (454 Life Science) generated 1,639,140 reads. Genome assembly was performed de novo using the sequence assembly software MIRA V2.9.43. Manual inspection and editing of the assembly was carried out using consed and custom Perl scripts.

Clustering of the shotgun reads and manual finishing of the assembly resulted in 820 contiguous sequences (contigs) with an N50 of 71,261 bp and an average genome coverage of 47X. The G + C content of the overall assembly is 47%. Gene prediction was performed using GLIMMER 3 and CRITICA. The vast majority of the P15 annotations were assigned using information from the WB and GS genomes.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_primary_virtual_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
An MluI optical map of the WB genome was generated. Scaffolds and contigs were mapped to the optical map and assembled into chromosomes.

Optical map of the Genotype A1 WB C6 Giardia lamblia genome isolate. Alexander D Perry, Hilary G Morrison, Rodney D Adam.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_microarrayExpression_Hehl_Stress-response_Temperature_Concentration_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Stress Response in Trophozoites - Temparature Redox
datasetPresenter.summary: Microarray expression profiles of G. lamblia Assemblage A trophozoite response to temparature or redox (DTT) stress
datasetPresenter.description:
Gene expression profiling of Giardia lamblia strain WBC6 during temperature or redox stress
Giardia lamblia strain WBC6 (ATCC catalog No. 50803) trophozoites were grown in 11 ml TYI-S-33 medium supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum and bovine bile. Parasites were grown to confluency at 37 degrees C, and medium was replaced prior to stress induction. Redox stress was induced by addition of Dithiothreitol (DTT, Fluka 43817) for 30 minutes to final concentrations of 7.1 mM, 14.2 mM or 21.3 mM. In the control cultures an equivalent amount of water was used. Temperature stress (40 degrees C) was induced by incubating parasites for 30 minutes at 40 degrees C (control 37 degrees C).

templateInjector.prop: log(2) ratio in upper graph or expression percentile value in lower graph.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_microarrayExpression_Hehl_Stress-response_Incubation_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Stress Response in Trophozoites - Incubation Time
datasetPresenter.summary: G. lamblia Assemblage A Stress Response in Trophozoites - Incubation Time
datasetPresenter.description: Giardia lamblia strain WBC6 (ATCC catalog No. 50803) trophozoites were grown in 11 ml TYI-S-33 medium supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum and bovine bile.Parasites were grown to confluency at 37 degrees C, and medium was replaced prior to stress induction. Redox stress was induced by addition of Dithiothreitol (DTT, Fluka 43817) for 30 minutes to final concentrations of 7.1 mM, 14.2 mM or 21.3 mM. In the control cultures an equivalent amount of water was used. Temperature stress (40 degrees C) was induced by incubating parasites for 30 minutes at 40 degrees C (control 37 degrees C).

templateInjector.prop: log(2) ratio in upper graph or expression percentile value in lower graph.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_microarrayExpression_Hehl_Encystation_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: G. lamblia Assemblage A isolate WB encystation microarray analysis
datasetPresenter.description:
Expression profiling of Giardia lamblia WB (ATCC catalog #50803) during encystation.

Encystation was induced in trophozoites using two different in vitro protocols: the standard 2-step, and lipid (cholesterol) starvation. RNA was isolated from encysting trophozoites at 45 min, 3 h, and 7 h post-induction using the standard 2-step protocol and at 7 h post-induction using the lipid starvation protocol. Total RNA was amplified, labeled with dye and used in dual-color hybridizations to a full-genome microarray with uninduced trophozoite RNA as the reference sample.

templateInjector.prop: log(2) ratio in upper graph or expression percentile value in lower graph.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_microarrayExpression_Ringqvist_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: G. lamblia Assemblage A array profiles of host-parasite interactions
datasetPresenter.description:
Transcriptional changes in Giardia during host-parasite interactions.

Trophozoites were incubated with or without host cells in the following manner. Differentiated Caco-2 cells were infected with Giardia WB clone trophozoites at a 10:1 ratio in DMEM medium. Mock infections were performed in DMEM with the same amount of trophozoites but no IECs under equal conditions. As a control for growth-induced transcriptional changes, the same amount of trophozoites were inoculated in TYDK growth medium in maximally filled tightly capped tubes. Cultures were harvested at 1.5, 6 and 18 hours post-infection.

Total RNA from separate interactions, converted into cDNA, was hybridised against the same amount of starting population trophozoite cDNA in a two-dye manner, on PFGRC Giardia version 2 70-mer oligoarrays.

templateInjector.prop: Fold Change in upper graph or expression percentile value in lower graph.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_Svard_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome profiling of Giardia intestinalis Assemblage A (WB) using strand-specific RNA-Seq
datasetPresenter.description:
Transcriptome of Giardia intestinalis Assemblage A (WB)
Trophozoite strand-specific RNA libraries were sequenced using the Illumina HiSeq2000 platform.
datasetPresenter.usage: EuPathDB maps the RNA-seq reads to the genome and allows users to search for genes based on this mapping. The transcript levels for individual genes are displayed as graphs on gene record pages. RNA-seq reads aligned to the genome can be displayed in GBrowse.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_SAGE_McArthurSageTags_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: G. lamblia Assemblage A Life Cycle Sage Tags
datasetPresenter.description:
Serial Analysis of Gene Expression in G. lamblia Assemblage A during the life cycle.

A confluent culture of trophozoites was used to inoculate fresh cultures at a density of 105 cells/ml and grown for 21 h. Cells were induced to encyst in vitro as previously described and RNA was extracted at 4, 12, 21, and 42 h of encystation and as cysts using TRIZOL (GIBCO). Excystation was carried out by a two-step method as described by Boucher and Gillin and RNA isolated at four time-points (Stage 1, Stage 2, 30 min, 60 min). Stage 1 is an acidic, reducing environment that models the stomach. Stage 2 consists of proteases in a slightly alkaline solution that mimics the small intestine. SAGE libraries were constructed following the I-SAGE protocol (Invitrogen, Carlsbad CA). Recombinant pZero was sequenced on an ABI 3700 or 3730xl sequencer. Sequences collected were analyzed with software created at the MBL specifically for Giardia SAGE analysis.

templateInjector.prop:
Time points post excystation or encystation are indicated in hours.
S1 (stage 1) = acidic condition to mimic the stomach.
S2 (Stage 2) = trypsin and slight alkaline conditions to mimic the small intestine.
Percent of sense and antisense transcripts within individual SAGE libraries.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_massSpec_Ratner_DTASelect-filter_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: G. lamblia Assemblage A Proteomics experimental bands for experient DTASelect-filter
datasetPresenter.description:
Giardia lamblia WB (genome project strain) grown axenically in TYI-S-33 medium supplemented with bile salts. Adherent trophozoites were harvested during log-phase growth (60-70% confluent) and proteins extracted in 8M Urea and SDS. 1 mg of extracted protein was digested with sequencing-grade modified trypsin and fractionated via strong cation exchange chromatography into 90 fractions. Each fraction was run via C-18 reverse phase chromatography and analyzed using an LTQ ProteomeX ion trap mass spectrometer (Thermo Finnigan). Peptide assignments were made using SEQUEST, and the individual runs were compiled using DTASelect.

Daniel M. Ratner, Michael Lubrano, Martin Steffen, John Samuelson. University of Washington, Department of Bioengineering.

Protocol adapted from Jaffe, J.D., Berg, H.C, Church, G. M. Proteogenomic mapping as a complementary method to perform genome annotation. Proteomics, 2004, 4, 59-7

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_massSpec_Emery_Virulence_Proteomics_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: G. lamblia Assemblage A Proteomics of virulent and avirulent Strains (Mass Spec peptides)
datasetPresenter.description:
Proteomic analysis of Giardia lamblia WB virulent (B-2041) and avirulent (H-106) strains.

A combination of both gel-based and in-solution platforms and sample preparations were used in this study.

Parasite cultures and Proteomic analysis:
Trophozoites were harvested from axenic cultures and protein extracts were either analyzed by SDS-PAGE followed by nanoLC-MS/MS or by filter-aided separation of protein (FASP) followed by with gas-phase fractionation (GPF) as an in-solution platform. The resulting peptide samples were analyzed by nanoLC-MS/MS on an LTQ-XL linear ion trap mass spectrometer. The LTQ-XL raw output files were converted into mzXML files and searched against the Giardiadb.org 2.5 release of G. duodenalis Assemblage A1 genome (WB Clone 6, ATCC 50803) using the global proteome machine (GPM) software (version 2.1.1) and the X!Tandem algorithm.

The MS proteomics data are deposited in the ProteomeXchange Consortium (http://proteomecentral.proteomexchange.org) via the PRIDE partner repository with the dataset identifier PDX000452.

Samples:
H-106 - gel LC-MS/MS : avirulent strain analyzed by SDS Page and LC-MS/MS
H-106 - GPF : avirulent strain analyzed by GPF
B-2041 - gel LC-MS/MS : virulent strain analyzed by SDS Page and LC-MS/MS
B-2041 - GPF : virulent strain analyzed by GPF

link.text: Data located at Proteome Central under identifier PXD000452

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_massSpec_Tachezy_Enriched_Fraction_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteome of G. lamblia Assemblage A isolate WB mitosome enriched fraction determined by LC-MS/MS.
datasetPresenter.description: G. intestinalis mitosome enriched fraction -- nanoLC/MALDI TOF/TOF Mitosome-enriched fractions were separated from a Giardia homogenate by preparative centrifugation using a discontinuous Optiprep (iodixanol) gradient. Samples were precipitated, pelleted, trypsin digested, labeled with sample-specific iTRAQ reagents and analyzed by LC-MS/MS. Resulting spectra were searched with locally installed Mascot v. 2.1 (Matrix Science) against the GiardiaDB release 1.3 annotated protein database (4892 sequences, 2663813 residues) and GiardiaDB release 1.2 Open Reading Frame translations greater than 50 amino acids (85612 sequences, 9633221 residues).

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_massSpec_Gillin_Proteomics_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: G. lamblia Assemblage A conserved and unique basal body proteins
datasetPresenter.description:
Trophozoite basal body proteome of G. lamblia Assemblage A (isolate WB-C6)
Trophozoites were collected from un-synchronized parasite cultures and used to prepare a basal body enriched fraction. Peptide samples were analyzed by MudPIT and the resulting MS spectra were evaluated with SEQUEST 3G and DTASelect.
datasetPresenter.usage: EuPathDB maps proteomics peptides to the genome and provides a search that returns genes based on these mappings. Peptide mappings are tabulated on gene record pages and peptides can be displayed in context with the genome using GBrowse.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_massSpec_Faso_time_course_encystation_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: G. lamblia Assemblage A (isolate WBC6) proteome during encystation
datasetPresenter.description:
G. lamblia Assemblage A (isolate WBC6) proteome during encystation using tandem mass spectrometry.

Trophozoites of the G. lamblia strain WBC6 (ATCC catalog number 50803) were grown under microaerophilic conditions. Encystation was induced using the 2-step method. At 0, 4, 8 and 12 hours post-induction of encystation, triplicate total protein extracts were prepared. The 0 hours post-induction of encystation timepoint represents cells grown in complete medium and not in PE medium.

Following resolution by one-dimension SDS-PAGE, each gel lane was cut to 10 pieces which were then separately subjected to in-gel tryptic digestion. Resulting peptides were measured by tandem mass spectrometry. MS/MS spectra were searched with Mascot version 2.2.04 against a proteome database with a (Giardia Genome release-1.2 25-Jun-2009) and a concatenated decoy database supplemented with contaminants (67,079 entries).
datasetPresenter.usage: EuPathDB maps proteomics peptides to the genome and provides a search that returns genes based on these mappings. Peptide mappings are tabulated on gene record pages and peptides can be displayed in context with the genome using GBrowse.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_DBP_GeneImage_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Cellular Localization of Trophozoite or Cytoskeletal GFP-fused proteins
datasetPresenter.summary: Subcellular localization of selected trophozoite or cytoskeletal proteins from Giardia Assemblage A isolate WB determined by live imaging of GFP-fusion strains.
datasetPresenter.description:
Subcellular localization of Giardia trophozoite or cytoskeletal proteins in GFP-fusion strains
Many Giardia proteins lack homology or have limited similarity to proteins in other organisms. As a first step in assessing the cellular function of novel Giardia proteins, C-terminal green fluorescent protein (GFP) or mNeon green (NG) fusions were used to determine the subcellular localization of selected Giardia ORFs that are either highly expressed in trophozoites or are components of the Giardia cytoskeleton as determined by proteomic analyses.

Gateway Clones and Electroporation into Giardia
ORFs plus 200 bp of upstream (5’UTR) sequence containing the native promoter were PCR-amplified from genomic DNA to create Gateway entry clones and subsequently cloned into Gateway expression vector pcGFP1F.pac (Hagen et al., 2011) to create C-terminal GFP fusion strains. Gateway expression GFP-fusion vectors were electroporated into Giardia cells and maintained by selection with puromycin (50 mg/ml).

Image collection and processing
For live imaging, GFP-fusion strains were incubated in modified TYI-S-33 medium with bovine bile in a 96-well black glass bottom plates for up to two hours at 37°C in a nitrogen-enriched atmosphere. The medium was replaced with 1X HEPES-Buffered Saline (HBS) and the trophozoites were incubated under the same conditions for an additional 30 minutes prior to imaging. Additional warm HBS washes were performed as needed during imaging to remove detached cells. Live imaging of attached trophozoites was performed using differential interference contrast (DIC) and epifluorescence with a Leica DMI6000B wide-field inverted fluorescence microscope (PlanApo 100X, NA 1.40 oil immersion objective) Optical sections were acquired at 0.2-μm intervals using Metamorph (MDS Technologies). Images were processed using Fiji, and two-dimensional maximum intensity projections were created from the three-dimensional data sets if required.

Imaging: Kari D. Hagen, Kristopher F. Nguyen

Gateway cloning of C-terminal GFP fusions: Kari D. Hagen, Matt P. Hirakawa, Jonathan K. Pham, Michael J. Cipriano, David J. Woessner, Brystal M. Forsythe, Tiffany Chase, Gregory T. Walker, Allen Tu, Lorita Boghospor, Sharon Jan, Gary Du, Albert C. Sek, Kimberley Song, Jacqueline Booker, Joseph Serrano, and Scott C. Dawson

Proteomics: Michael J. Cipriano, Christopher Nosala, Kari D. Hagen, Moises J. De La Torre

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_Tolba_TSSseq_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Trophozoite transcription start sites of Giardia lamblia Assemblage A isolate WB (ATCC 50803), determined by strand-specific TSS-sequencing.
datasetPresenter.description:
Transcriptional start site sequencing analysis of Giardia lamblia trophozoite WB strain (ATCC 50803).

Transcription Start Site Sequencing:
Total RNA was subjected to oligo-capping treatment that replaces the 5' cap structure of transcripts with a known oligo sequence. Poly(A)-RNA was selected, PCR amplified and subjected to RNA sequencing using strand-specific Illumina methods.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_Tolba_RNAseq_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Trophozoite transcriptome of Giardia lamblia Assemblage A isolate WB (ATCC 50803) determined by RNA-sequencing.
datasetPresenter.description:
RNA sequencing analysis of Giardia lamblia trophozoite WB strain (ATCC 50803).

Total RNA from trophozoites was analyzed by high throughput sequencing using TruSeq Illumina methods.

datasetPresenter.name: ssalATCC50377_Feifei_trophozoites_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Transcriptome from pooled trophozoite exponential and stationary stages
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome of Spironucleus salmonicida determined by Illumina RNA sequencing.
datasetPresenter.description:
Transcriptome of Spironucleus salmonicida ATCC50377 from a mixed culture of exponential and stationary phase cells.

Total RNA of Spironucleus salmonicida was harvested from two batches of trophozoites exponential and stationary stages of growth using standard methods. Equal amounts of total RNA from the two growth stages were pooled and mRNA was isolated using polyA-selection. Non strand-specific, paired-end libraries were sequenced using Illumina techniques.

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_Pham_Intestine_Foci_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.shortDisplayName: Transcriptome from Giardia foci in murine intestine
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome from Giardia foci in murine intestine
datasetPresenter.description: Total RNA was extracted by from Giardia-infected intestinal segmentsPoly(A) selection was performed for both the intestinal foci and in vitro culture samples with one microgram of total RNA. Illumina sequencing libraries were constructed and ribosomal RNA was depleted (UC Davis DNA Technologies Core Facility, Davis, CA) for downstream Illumina sequencing. 120–180 million 50 bp, single end reads were subsequently generated via Illumina sequencing (HiSeq 2500 system).

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_smallNcRna_Wang_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Illumina RNA sequencing of small RNAs that co-precipitate with the Argonaute protein
datasetPresenter.description:
Giardia lamblia WB trophozoites express only a single variant-specific surface protein (VSP) on the cell surface from 73 VSP genes. To investigate whether microRNAs (miRNAs) could be associated with repression of the genes that are not expressed, RNA species that co-precipitate with Argonaute, a component of the RNAi pathway, were sequenced.

Two independent libraries were constructed using a previously published protocol (TDIP1 and TDIP2). In addition, one library (TDSIP) was created using an additional sonification step to ensure complete trophozoite breakdown - this was not found to significantly affect the outcome. Libraries were sequenced using Illumina Hi-Seq 2500.

Mapping of miRNAs using Bowtie2 revealed 99 new putative miRNAs with corresponding binding sites in VSP transcripts

datasetPresenter.name: gassAWB_massSpec_Coelho_Soluble_Insoluble_Fraction_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Soluble and insoluble trophozoite protein fractions (BHFC1)
datasetPresenter.summary: Soluble and insoluble protein fraction proteomics of Giardia duodenalis BHFC1 aligned to Giardia assemblage A isolate WB.
datasetPresenter.description: <u>Soluble and Insoluble proteins from trophozoiztes</u>: Trophozoites collected after 72 hours of culture were used to prepare soluble and insoluble protein fractions. Protein content was determined by 2-D Electrophoresis followed by MALDI-TOF mass spectrometry. Peak lists were searched against a parasite database created by the authors using Mascot version 2.1.
datasetPresenter.usage: EuPathDB maps proteomics peptides to the genome and provides a search that returns genes based on these mappings. Peptide mappings are tabulated on gene record pages and peptides can be displayed in context with the genome using GBrowse.

datasetPresenter.name: _dbxref_duodenalis_structures_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Giardia duodenalis structures prediction
datasetPresenter.description: Three dimensional structures were predicted for proteins encoded in the Giardia duodenalis genome (strain WB, assemblage A, release 39) using the I-TASSER software suite (Yang et al Nature Methods 2015 10.1038/nmeth.3213). The closest structural homologue in the protein databank was identified for each predicted structure. Predicted structures were assigned to high or low confidence categories depending on the presence of at least one matching PFAM domain in the query and reference peptides. Further information is available in 10.1093/gigascience/giy150 and at Predictein.
